rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment reports factual statistics ('Nine cases had exposure').
The segment does not contain a moderate verb paired with significant scale or impact.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
This segment reports a fact (case source) and lacks explicit calming language.
Segment does not contain a minimiser used with scale contrast.
The segment states cases had exposure but contains no bare negation.
The segment reports case details, not capabilities or preparedness.
Reports numerical metrics ('Nine cases') using standard verbs ('had exposure').
